inclusion.criterion: Acute myocardial infarction (STEMI or NSTEMI) within 48 hours from the onset of symptoms.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Baseline LDL-C above 125 mg/dl for those who were not on consistent lipid lowering therapy; or above 100 mg/dl for those who were compliant (≥ 90 days) on moderate intensity statin therapy.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Refusal to participate in the study.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Proved intolerance to statins on previous use.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Having conditions (or taking medications) that would not allow concomitant safe statins use. [such as patients receiving Cyclosporine - Gemfibrozil -Pazopanib - Tipranavir - Itraconazole - Ketoconazole]
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Those who are already compliant on high intensity statins.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Those who are already on statins plus non-statin agent (ezetimibe-PCSK9i-BAS).
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Known familial dyslipidemia or having TG>500 mg/dl or LDL-C>190 mg/dl which are highly suggestive of familial or secondary causes.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Pregnant or contemplating pregnancy in the following 12 months. [relevant for females in the child-bearing period]
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has vomiting, non-bloody diarrhea, abdominal pain, fever, chills and loss of appetite for the past 3 days. He ate a salad at a restaurant prior to his diarrhea onset.
